  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
I’ll be anchoring tonight’s broadcast
  from North Carolina, home of Duke University,
  where the sensational case of three lacrosse players accused of sexual
  assault has unfolded. Now comes redemption for the accused former college
  students, Reade Seligmann, David Evans and Collin Finnerty. Prosecutors have
  decided to drop all criminal charges against the young men, saying the
  athletes were victims of a “tragic rush to accuse” by District
  Attorney Mike Nifong – who himself is now under scrutiny. I’ll
  have that story and my colleagues will be with me in North Carolina covering all the angles.
 
The rape accusation last spring has had widespread
  ramifications – it has stoked racial tensions in the Raleigh-Durham
  community, scarred three families and tarnished the reputation of one of the
  country’s top universities – but, as Bob Orr will report, the
  legal case really was no case at all. 
 
Despite that, the parents of the three accused men,
  who are now 20, 21 and 24 years old, spent an estimated $3.5 million on
  lawyers. All three are now vindicated, but are still victims. Byron Pitts
  will take a look at how the accusation has changed the lives of the accused
  young men and will tell us where they are now.
 
Another reputation tarnished by the accusations was
  that of one of the country’s top higher education institutions: Duke University.
  Kelly Wallace will take a look at the media glare that focused on Duke and
  its lacrosse team for the past year and assess the impact of the accusation
  on the campus and community.
 
And then we’ll turn to the controversy over
  on-air comments made by Don Imus about the Rutgers
  women’s basketball team. The radio host was suspended for two weeks
  after making the remarks, but it is yet to be seen whether he will stay in
  his position. But how much is he worth to his broadcasters and advertisers?
  Anthony Mason will have the story.
 
Finally, I sat down with the family of Reid
  Seligmann, one of the accused Duke lacrosse players. I’ll share our
  conversation with you tonight.
 
I hope you’ll join us.
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
